item.description:
Hike up from Parking lot on Poole Rd. White Dot to Cascade Link to Spellman to Pumpelly. After exploring the area around the hut hike the Pumpelly to the Summit.
Return over the White Dot to White Cross to parking area.


Pumpelly's Hut is one of Monadnocks hidden gems. Most hikers have never seen it, only heard the stories. Built on a ledge 100' below the Pumpelly trail by the grandson of the blazer of the Pumpelly trail , Raphael Pumpelly and the grandson of local artist Abbot Thayer in 1903. Hard to find and well worth the trip. Come see the white palm tree. Rumors are that soon it will be locked up because of vandalism.
Around 5 miles round trip, 3-5 hours hiking time

The Spellman Trail is extremely steep, close to what you'd find in the White Mountains!!

Hiking down to the hut will require scrambling down a short section of ledge. I've taken young and old down this way, we'll take our time to make it a safe hike.

I hiked this trailÂ  9/22. 4 hour hike.

Meet at the State Park Store, $5 admission. Please be early, we'll wait only 15 minutes past the start time for late arrivals.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Mt. Monadnock Hike to Pumpelly's Hut / Summit
